alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 30 at 11:15AM EDT until April 02 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. .Heavy rainfall may cause the Rifle River near Sterling to climb above flood stage by Friday morning. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 3.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Rifle River Sterling 6.0 3.3 Wed 10 am ED 4.2 7.0 5.6 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT or when new forecast information becomes available.
